ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: (You started flying toward it, so I thought you were bringing it to me. Wolves don t fly.) well anyway, Lunarpine exits the pod, The green jungle of Tibet

(You started flying toward it, so I thought you were bringing it to 
me. Wolves don't fly.)

well anyway, Lunarpine exits the pod, The green jungle of Tibet 
nearly hypnotized him. The green was a surprisingly nice change from 
what he was usedto. the myriad of smells told him he would eat well 
here. 

Lunarpine followed Shadow Wing toward the Ark.

"So how longs it been since your last visit?"He asked hoping they'd 
remember her.He'd hate to be greeted by gunfire.--- In 
nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> (didn't realize we made it to the pod that fast or that I had the 
controls 
> already.)
> 
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She transformed into bot mode and hopped in.  She took the Controls 
and 
> started up the pod.  It jumped across the oceans in a few minutes.  
The pod 
> landed on a mountain near the Ark.
> "Well, we're here." She jumped out and looked at Lunarpine. "It's 
not much, 
> but it's liveable."
> She started to walk to the Ark.
> 
> 
> -----Original Message----
> From:   <cyberwolf4@p...>
> Date: Fri Jun 30, 2000 9:16pm
> Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
> 
> 
> 
> The transport pod lowered to grant Lunarpine access. He stepped in
> with a quick gracefull leap.
> Lunarpine thought about the three questions that must go through
> every transformers CPU when they're reformatted: What have I become?
> Why are we here?and most of all Will I change when the other two
> questions are answered?
> 
> He looked at Shadowwing at the controls, he saw how natural it
> appeared, and with the word "MAXIMIZE" he transformed and took a 
seat
> at her left.
> Something about the panel brought back memories, he remembered a
> similar situation with him at navigation.The memory was vague, but 
it
> was there. He looked back at Shadowwing and said "well this is
> it.Lets fly."
> 
> With one last glance outside Lunarpine couldn't help thinking "Hope
> I'm ready for the Maximals again: But are the Maximals ready for 
me."
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
